text: @Reaper679 This entire song was actually composed and recorded by Ron Burgundy himself.  The entire piece was improvised and this was the first and only take.  Ron attributed his inspiration for this piece to his best friend and soul mate, Baxter.

text:
I kinda agree that Returns was more "goofy" than the first two DKCs (3 wasn't like those ones too,only in a couple levels) but let's face it,DKC's were made by freakin' Rare. It's hard to do something like Rare did,all of its games with Nintendo are really unique.

But Returns it's a great platformer nonethless,it has incredible level design.

text: Sounds like Ron Burgundy when the flute kicks in.
author: Reaper679

text: Can only hope they do DKCR 2 with DKC2 remixes. This is by far my favorite game on the wii. Considering David Wise and Rare had nothing to do with this game other than provide the inspiration for the level design and original music, I think it game out very good. I hope on the next game they make the bonus levels more of a part of the game as they did in DKC 2 and 3
author: BigAngryPhil

text: @Sephiko This ain't your diary.
author: Q

text: @kurtTraver totally agree, the world was a little more light-hearted and glossy than the way we're used to seeing it. I have another complaint to add to that, and I think it's very related, and it's that the music itself made the game feel more silly too. Older DK games had a mysterious, gloomy, ominous feeling, which was half the art direction and half Wise's music. We're missing both halves here, and while I liked the gameplay in this one, I wasn't too happy with the overly upbeat score.
author: nessx007

text: @pikminlover72 Well exCUSE me for not seeing your "clarified response" when I made my initial response.
author: Rubberman202

text:
@pikminlover72 Uh...  Yeah, that's bull.  That's the same as saying This Donkey Kong, Diddy Kong, Cranky Kong, and all the original Donkey Kong Country characters belong to Rare.

If Nintendo could use them in spin-offs, such as Mario Super Sluggers, they can use them in another Donkey Kong Country game.
author: Rubberman202

text: Love this game to pieces. I knew people would be disappointed with it and reviewers would give it slightly-above-average scores because it's not an exact carbon copy of the original DKC trilogy or because it doesn't have Kremlings, but that's okay by me. I'll keep this game on a high pedestal in my mind, and others can think whatever they want.
author: I fight for my friends Ultimate

text: I finally beat this game last month. It was maybe slightly more frustrating than I would have liked, but that's probably more a fault of mine. It was also disappointing to not get new Wise compositions, like you said. But honestly, my biggest complaint was none of those things. The thing I least liked was that they chose to make the world much more... silly, than in the original games. I missed the atmosphere those games created
author: kurtTraver

author: Jay5006

text: @map586 I've actually seen a great deal of Skyward Sword and it's far from a masterpiece to me. Still great but a lot of the flaws the franchise always had are more apparent now than ever and too many games this gen have surpassed it in other areas where it feels dated. The game starts off even slower than TP is which highly annoyed me. This generation hasn't been that impressive to me as a whole though. Currently, Batman Arkham City has been wowing me everywhere. Now THAT is a masterpiece.

text: I just couldn't play this game with the Wiimote as much as I tried. I wanted to enjoy this game but me and the Wiimote just don't mix. I can only play games with actual controllers. Here's hoping the Wii-U resolves that problem and that I can finally be ably to play and enjoy the few good Wii games like this one. missing out on Skyward Sword because I just can't stand to play it with the Wiimote just kills me. It was the reason why I got Twilight Princess on Gamecube instead of on Wii.
author: xOmniCloudx

text:
@pikminlover72 Nintendo has to have certain rights over the series.
Because they were able to(and still are)release the Donkey Kong Country related things, all the rareware stuff.
Though it'd save a lot of trouble if they'd just take rareware back.
A.) Not like Microsoft actually does anything with them.
B.) They got rid of them because of Conker and Rare's habit for inappropriate. But nowadays Nintendo has all ratings on their stuff, it wouldn't matter anymore.

text: This might have been my game of the year in 2010, I loved it. The level design was almost perfect and I loved the graphics. The soundtrack was great, though I'd have prefered it to be composed by David Wise. Yamamoto did a great job though, especially with remixes like this one.
